intro: Webbia oligocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed webbia, is a flowering plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Mesembryanthemaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, fleshy leaves and distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in arid gardens and rockeries.
